page.title: 13Lower Brockhampton
page.content: Lower Brockhampton is a black and white moated manor house.Today it is a farmhouse one room serves as a minimum.There is a lot of armour and a big oak table with long benches and there are even the old fire buckets. To date the old manor house has been standing for over 350 years and is very old fashioned. The house continued to be lived in either by a farming tenant or employee and fortunately was never modennised. Lower Brockhampton is today in the care of the National Trust and still the home of a farming family. A delightful drive winding steeply down though woodland and stream from the lodge at the A44 is a pleasure enjoyed by many visitors before reaching the seclusion of the postion of Lower Brockhampton in a beautiful valley.
